intro: Doliocarpus sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flowered doliocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashews and mangoes. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed enclosed in a hard, woody husk. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species in botanical research.
